sections.title: The Safe Zone?

chapters.goal: Artie needs gear that compensates for his 1 HP pool and exploits the System's bugs.

sections.intent: Equip Artie with the bare minimum to survive a dungeon through exploits.

scenes.outcome: Artie is stuck with a lighthouse-beacon for monsters.
scenes.summary: Artie tries to sell his 'Participation Trophy' but finds out it's soul-bound and cursed.

scenes.outcome: Artie successfully crits a lock, causing it to explode into gold dust.
scenes.summary: Fizz points out a loophole in the 'Starter Pack' quest that allows Artie to steal a high-tier cloak if he can crit a lock.

scenes.end_condition_echo: Artie acquires the 'Cloak of the Cowardly Lion' and a cursed beacon item.
scenes.outcome: Artie is now slightly harder to hit but looks like a neon yellow cat.
scenes.summary: Artie acquires the 'Cloak of the Cowardly Lion,' which gives +50 Evasion but -100 Dignity.

scenes.outcome: Artie begins to treat the world like a rhythm game.
scenes.summary: Artie enters the Crypts and finds that the skeletons move in predictable, turn-based patterns.

scenes.outcome: Artie survives his first ranged encounter and gains confidence.
scenes.summary: A Skeleton Archer fires at Artie; the Cloak's evasion procs, causing Artie to do an accidental backflip.

scenes.end_condition_echo: Artie discovers he can farm resources via System Overload effects.
scenes.outcome: Artie discovers he can farm resources via System Overload effects.
scenes.summary: Artie realizes his crits don't just do damage; they cause 'System Overload' effects like turning enemies into loot-filled pinatas.

sections.title: The Crypt of Bad Math

scenes.outcome: Artie sees the gap between a 'proper' build and his own.
scenes.summary: Vane enters the crypts with a full party, clearing rooms with ease while Artie hides in a sarcophagus.

scenes.outcome: Artie decides to take the risk and summon the boss for the massive XP.

scenes.end_condition_echo: The Bone Golem emerges, placing Artie at a massive mechanical disadvantage.

sections.title: The Rival's Shadow

chapters.stakes_shift: Survival shifts from pure luck to the tactical exploitation of game mechanics and item loopholes.
chapters.title: The Glass Cannon's Guide to Not Dying

bridge.from_prev: The Bone Golem is summoned, forcing Artie into a fight he isn't built for.
bridge.to_next: Artie flees the crypts with legendary-tier items and a high-level rival on his heels.

chapters.goal: Defeat the Floor Guardian and secure the first major loot drop of the series.

sections.intent: A high-octane fight where Artie must dodge every single attack.

scenes.outcome: The Golem's armor is shattered, but Artie is running out of stamina.
scenes.summary: Artie uses the Crypt environment to kite the Bone Golem, using 'Crit-Punches' to chip away at its armor.

scenes.outcome: Artie must find a way to bypass the resistance or die.
scenes.summary: Fizz discovers that the Golem has a 'Crit-Resist' buff, making Artie's main weapon useless.

scenes.end_condition_echo: Artie collapses the floor, trapping the Golem in a physics glitch.
scenes.outcome: The floor collapses, trapping the Golem in a hole.
scenes.summary: Artie attempts to 'Crit' the ground beneath the Golem, hoping for a physics glitch.

sections.title: The Dance of Death

sections.intent: Resolve the boss fight with a comedic but effective exploit.

scenes.outcome: Artie prepares his most powerful hit yet.
scenes.summary: While the Golem is stuck, Artie spends five minutes 'charging' a punch, which the System interprets as a 'Heavy Attack'.

scenes.outcome: The boss is defeated, but the loot is... unconventional.
scenes.summary: Artie lands the hit, but instead of damage, the System rolls a 'Cosmetic Crit,' turning the Golem into a pile of very expensive porcelain teacups.

scenes.end_condition_echo: Artie hits Level 10 and the System begins monitoring him closely.
scenes.outcome: Artie is now Level 10, but the System is watching him more closely.
scenes.summary: The System panics and tries to 'recalculate' the XP, resulting in Artie jumping five levels instantly.

sections.title: The Final Blow

sections.intent: Examine the rewards and the consequences of the fight.

scenes.outcome: Artie accepts the double-edged sword.
scenes.summary: Artie finds a 'Ring of the Gambler' among the teacups, which doubles crit damage but makes every 20th hit a self-crit.

scenes.outcome: Artie realizes he isn't the first person to break this game.
scenes.summary: A hidden door opens, revealing a mural of the 'First Glitch'—a hero who looked suspiciously like Artie's high school gym teacher.

scenes.outcome: Vane realizes Artie stole his kill.
scenes.summary: Artie exits the crypt to find Vane waiting for him, looking very confused by the lack of a boss.

scenes.end_condition_echo: Artie uses his new speed to outrun Vane's party toward the capital.
scenes.outcome: The chase is on.
scenes.summary: Artie uses his new level-up speed to outrun Vane's party, heading toward the capital city.

chapters.goal: Artie must win the tournament brackets without taking a single point of damage.

sections.intent: Show Artie's growth and tactical use of his crits in the arena.

scenes.outcome: The crowd goes wild; Artie is the 'One-Hit Wonder'.
scenes.summary: Artie faces a 'Tank' who has 10,000 HP. Artie wins in one second by critting the Tank's belt buckle, causing his armor to fall off and disqualify him.

scenes.outcome: Artie has to learn to time his punches with the wind gusts.
scenes.summary: The System tries to nerf Artie mid-match by introducing 'Wind Resistance'.

scenes.end_condition_echo: Artie moves to the quarter-finals despite mid-match System nerfs.
scenes.outcome: Artie moves to the quarter-finals despite mid-match System nerfs.
scenes.summary: Artie wins the second round by critting the air so hard it creates a vacuum, sucking his opponent out of the ring.

sections.title: The Round of 32

sections.intent: Artie faces a character with high evasion, forcing a change in strategy.

scenes.outcome: The fight becomes a high-speed game of tag.
scenes.summary: Artie's opponent is a 'Dodge-Build' rogue who also has low HP.

scenes.outcome: Artie realizes he needs to change his strategy.
scenes.summary: Neither can land a hit for ten minutes. The crowd starts booing.

scenes.outcome: Artie wins, but the 'Trophy' is now glowing with dark energy.
scenes.summary: Artie uses his 'Participation Trophy' to lure a swarm of arena-flies, which distract the rogue just long enough for a crit.

scenes.end_condition_echo: The System applies a 'Random Debuff' to Artie for his next match.

scenes.summary: Artie's debuff is 'Inverted Controls'. Every time he tries to move left, he goes right.

scenes.outcome: Artie manages to reach the Mage and lands a crit that turns the Mage's staff into a rubber chicken.
scenes.summary: Artie's opponent is a Mage who uses AOE spells. Artie has to 'moonwalk' through the fireballs.

scenes.outcome: Artie reaches the finals.

scenes.end_condition_echo: Artie reaches the finals against a rigged Vane.

chapters.goal: Defeat Vane in the rigged finals and survive the System's direct intervention.

sections.intent: Show the power of a 'Whale' player vs. a 'Glitch' player.

scenes.outcome: Artie's main weapon is now a suicide button.
scenes.summary: Vane enters with legendary armor that reflects 50% of all damage. Artie realizes if he crits Vane, he crits himself.

scenes.outcome: Artie is now a 1 HP character who can't dodge.
scenes.summary: Vane uses the 'System Override' scroll to turn off Artie's Evasion stat.

scenes.outcome: Artie can move in 3D, bypassing the 'No-Evasion' ground rule.
scenes.summary: Fizz sacrifices her 'Guide' status to temporarily hack the arena's gravity, giving Artie a few seconds of weightlessness.

scenes.end_condition_echo: Artie targets the magic aura around Vane's armor to bypass the Reflect buff.
scenes.outcome: Artie targets the magic aura around Vane's armor to bypass the Reflect buff.
scenes.summary: Artie realizes he doesn't need to hit Vane; he needs to hit the 'Reflect' buff itself.

sections.title: Vane's Ultimate Build

sections.intent: The moment of peak absurdity where the world begins to dissolve.

scenes.outcome: The arena begins to pixelate and dissolve.
scenes.summary: Artie lands a 'Meta-Crit' on the Reflect buff. The System can't handle the math of a crit reflecting a crit reflecting a crit.

scenes.outcome: Vane is defenseless and terrified.
scenes.summary: Vane panics as his armor turns into a swarm of error messages.

scenes.outcome: Vane is kicked from the game, and Artie is the champion of a broken world.
scenes.summary: Artie delivers the final blow—a crit so powerful it deletes Vane's character data (but not the person).

scenes.outcome: The true antagonist is revealed.
scenes.summary: The System Administrator (a giant floating head) appears to manually delete Artie.

scenes.outcome: Artie has successfully 'paused' reality.
scenes.summary: Artie crits the Admin's 'Delete' button, causing the entire world to freeze.

scenes.end_condition_echo: Artie and Fizz escape deletion as the world enters 'Safe Mode'.
scenes.outcome: Artie and Fizz escape deletion as the world enters 'Safe Mode'.
